definitions.definition: Thermal energy.
definitions.example: This furnace puts out 5000 BTUs of heat.   That engine is really throwing off some heat.   Removal of heat from the liquid caused it to turn into a solid.

definitions.definition: The condition or quality of being hot.
definitions.example: Stay out of the heat of the sun!

definitions.definition: An attribute of a spice that causes a burning sensation in the mouth.
definitions.example: The chili sauce gave the dish heat.

definitions.definition: A period of intensity, particularly of emotion.
definitions.example: It's easy to make bad decisions in the heat of the moment.

definitions.definition: An undesirable amount of attention.
definitions.example: The heat from her family after her DUI arrest was unbearable.

definitions.definition: The police.
One or more firearms.
A fastball.
definitions.example: The catcher called for the heat, high and tight.

definitions.definition: A condition where a mammal is aroused sexually or where it is especially fertile and therefore eager to mate.
definitions.example: The male canines were attracted by the female in heat.

definitions.definition: A preliminary race, used to determine the participants in a final race
definitions.example: The runner had high hopes, but was out of contention after the first heat.

definitions.definition: One cycle of bringing metal to maximum temperature and working it until it is too cool to work further.
definitions.example: I can make a scroll like that in a single heat.

definitions.definition: A hot spell.
definitions.example: The children stayed indoors during this year's summer heat.

definitions.definition: Heating system; a system that raises the temperature of a room or building.
definitions.example: I'm freezing; could you turn on the heat?

definitions.definition: The output of a heating system.
definitions.example: During the power outage we had no heat because the controls are electric.   Older folks like more heat than the young.

definitions.definition: In omegaverse fiction, a cyclical period in which alphas and omegas experience an intense, sometimes irresistible biological urge to mate.
To cause an increase in temperature of (an object or space); to cause to become hot (often with "up").
To become hotter.
definitions.example: There's a pot of soup heating on the stove.

definitions.definition: To excite or make hot by action or emotion; to make feverish.
To excite ardour in; to rouse to action; to excite to excess; to inflame, as the passions.
To arouse, to excite (sexually).
